text:
Freeline skate il a new extreme sport. He was invented by Alex Dupont in Paris, in Paris but it is much more popular in Asia. It beginning to develop in Europe and in Paris few years ago. It is practiced with two little plank of wood, smaller that a foot, and connected with two wheels for each foot. The planks are not fixed at feets so we can manipulate them like we want, we can take one with a hand or totally remove to do some figures. The objective is to do the figures the most complicates and impresives or go as fast as possible. It is practiced in the street, where the floor is plane and the espace is suffisant for do figures and go as fast as possible or in skateparks. It can be dangerous because it's hard to controllate, we need a lot of experience to learn to keep our balance and realize some basic figures, I think it's harder than skateboard or longboard because the balance is much complicate due to the two parts and the size of the skate.
 The injuries who we can see are commotions, bruises, contusion, broken bones or muscle injuries because we can easly fall in a bad position. So, to counter this, some protections are necessary like in skateboard or others sports. Helmet, knee and elbow protections are obligatory and others like chestplate, boots and tibia protections can be good for a full protection. Moreover some active streching and muscular training can be good before practicing to avoid the muscular injuries. The benfits of freeline skate are a developement of creativity, moticity and can give some freedom. Also, it can learn some moral values like "Never give up" or "Always get up after falling".
